label: CT32
info_overview: The Z-Wave enabled CT32 thermostat is a compact, easy-to-use thermostat that is packed with functionality. The CT32 has a responsive touchscreen interface, easy-to-read backlight display, and 7-day programmability. It features a system lock to avoid unintentional changes for maximum efficiency, a filter change indicator to keep your HVAC system running efficiently, wide temperature operation range, and room temperature calibration for precise control.
info_inclusion: Go to Menu screen, and press INCLUDE icon.
info_exclusion: Go to Menu screen, and press EXCLUDE icon.
info_wakeup: When included into a Z-Wave network on battery power, this device is a FLiRS device. The Thermostat will wake up for communication when it receives a valid Z-Wave beam.

parameters.label: Temperature Reporting Threshold
parameters.description: Sets the reporting threshold for changes in ambient temperature.
parameters.overview: The Temperature Reporting Threshold Configuration Set Command sets the reporting threshold for changes in the ambient temperature as detected by the thermostat.

parameters.label: Utility Lock Enable/Disable
parameters.description: Enables or Disables the Utility Lock.
parameters.overview: The Utility Lock Configuration Set command enables or disables the utility lock. If the utility lock is enabled, the setpoint cannot be modified directly via the thermostat screen.

parameters.label: Humidity Reporting Threshold
parameters.description: Sets the reporting threshold for changes in humidity.
parameters.overview: The Humidity Threshold Configuration Set Command sets the reporting threshold for changes in the relative humidity as detected by the thermostat.

parameters.label: Auxiliary/Emergency
parameters.description: Enables or Disables the Aux / Emergency Heat.
parameters.overview: The Auxiliary/Emergency configuration command enables or disables auxiliary / emergency heating in the thermostat. Auxiliary / emergency heating is only available if the thermostat is configured in heat pump mode and with at least one stage of auxiliary h

parameters.label: Swing Temperature
parameters.description: Sets the swing threshold before turning on / off HVAC.
parameters.overview: The Thermostat Swing Temperature configuration command sets swing temperature on the thermostat. The swing temperature is applied to the setpoint to determine when the thermostat will turn on the HVAC system.

parameters.label: Thermostat Diff Temperature
parameters.description: Set's the differential temperature for multi-stage HVAC systems.
parameters.overview: The Thermostat Differential Temperature configuration command sets the differential temperature for multi-stage HVAC systems. The differential temperature delta defines when the thermostat will turn on additional stages.

parameters.label: Thermostat Recovery Mode
parameters.description: This parameter defines the thermostat recovery mode.

options.label: Recovery Mode is set to fast.
Recovery Mode is set to economy.

parameters.label: Simple UI Mode Enable/Disable
parameters.description: Enables or Disables Simple UI Mode
parameters.overview: If set to 0, Simple UI Mode is disabled, if set to 1, will enable the Simple UI Mode.

parameters.label: Multicast Enable/Disable
parameters.description: If set to 0, multicast is disabled, if set to 1, will enable the multicast.

commandclass.name: NO_OPERATION
commandclass.label: No Operation - used for PINGing a device.
